te0Dec7RH4a-UkIz-VqWpA.text: Cheap noodle bar in Soho, on Old Compton Street. The food is cheap, but it shows in the quality. Don't expect a gourmet meal, but if you're looking for something cheap, filling, and quick then look no further. It's clean and pleasant inside, but it's certainly nothing special.

cBafWOO63EDPbqrN9v6CQg.text: Don't come here if you expect good service but do come here if you are after some delicious, quick and very reasonably priced food. The menu has a selection of singapore noodles, indonesian dishes and chinese dishes. The portions are also excellent- you can get a very large plate of noodles for under £4- although I believe they may have brought in a minimum spend now. Cheeky I know but the service in this place is laughable- literally. It has actually felt like they have thrown the plate at me sometimes, yet something about it just adds to the character and you don't seem to mind so much when you are getting such good value for money. They also offer a small selection of foreign beers and some nice fruit shakes.

qhGh7ESG0Ch7DaNN9LO33g.text: At here once, Was it once near Charing Cross road? Anyway, had a huge bowl of noodle soup, glass noodles?, veggies, not fishy flavour. bowl so large we split it between two. Anyone know what the soup was called? Delicious, cheap.

XT-CpNYKvVNJlZQdaZigSg.text: I've been dining in here for years now whenever I'm in London, and it's leagues ahead of anything that's in Chinatown for the same amount of money. The dishes are truly excellent - I've yet to pick a duffer, but the Pad Thai, salted ribs and spicy chicken noodles are among the best. Many will be put off by the fact it is located smack bang in the middle of the gay village (and there is no denying the pink pound makes up a lot of Tuk Tuk's turnover) - but this is Soho after all, and anything goes!! On the downside, the furnishings are clinical, the staff a bit surly and you soon get the hint when it's time to pay up and leave if its busy. Don't waste your money on an overpriced KFC in the West End - come here instead - you won't regret it believe me!

E3cx6wKqXjfFv9WCHUD5-g.text: I've eaten in Tuk Tuk ever since it was on Charing Cross Road. The quality does seem to have suffered a bit since it has moved to Old Compton Street, but I can only assume that is because of how busy it has become. Still, it's position now means that it's great for a bite to eat before going on to a bar or club and the fact that it's always full when I visit is testament to it's popularity. I love the pad Thai here, which costs around £4.50 for a huge portion. Don't expect much in the way of service though, they barely manage a rushed 'thankyoubye' as you're leaving and I've lost count of the number of times my card has been returned to my (male) partner even though I was the one paying! Still, good food for an unbeatable price in this area.

CnoVWtJhGIvWuHaAjbp1iA.text: The spot is perfect for grabbing a quick bite or having a nice long lunch. I'm happy with everything on the menu. I've already tried a big part of it and everything is delicious. I can't complain from the service  it's always professional!

OsQ-DU6SebaoYO8sZFiZ6A.text: After a Zumba session I decided I needed some Tom Yum so I went on a search around Soho figuring I'd find something. I found out that Tuk Tuk sold Tom Yum (or tom yam? same thing though) so I got it for takeaway. Service was very quick and the man was kind and helpful. Be prepared for a 50p charge if you use card for orders under £10, though. I didn't mind that at all, just wanted to eat!! I got home and got all ready. They packed the noodles separately which I appreciated, so that they wouldn't be soggy. I enjoyed the soup, though it's not the best tom yum I've ever had. I'll definitely keep looking, but I am glad to be able to get such quick service for a reasonable price (and loads of noodles :D)

jBGSKw8aiod9ly20Sj342Q.text: Really enjoyed it here, the food was nicely prepared and tasted nice! Apart from some dishes tasted sweeter than what I've tasted when in Thailand! Apart from that can't fault them, very polite and always checking if drinks needed filling etc!

4w4SnedN9ttO4Ft5SoXP0g.text: I had the Serang Fried Rice here for 5 pounds. Would recommend it. Pretty decent prices for London.

s9fMC7PAGZUkTukNE63ixA.text: obviously depends what day you go on...wednesday night = less spicy soup and slower serviceso take your pick, i still love it!

8ZBsZ3m8WCXjbbbw9IkIQA.text: Tuk tuk is yuk yuk. Though it seems popular, this was a dreadful experience. Though they pass themselves off as Thai, no one knew Thai food or language. I think the staff was Philippine. Everything was greasy and the duck must have been sun dried, freeze dried and put on the drier cycle. Dreadful. I asked for Thai iced Coffee they brought iced tea. No American express cards. Avoid at all costs. Bad food and bad attitude. There's no excuse for bad Thai food.

wDC3OxCbxP2-ZyS-aZCC0g.text: Fast and somewhat furious service, but this is fast food Thai. No lazing around. Get the menus. Look. Decide. Quick. Now. Are you ready? Not yet, give me a minute, please. Oh, hi waiter man, you really took me at my word and came back exactly a minute later. I'll have a number 8, yes the spicy chicken noodle soup, and some side order prawns too. And a bottle of house white. Tasty enough, no complaints. Thank you. And only £13 a head (for two very full up ladies with half a bottle of wine sunk each). Very good. Thank you.

xpvvKl4xmUVHe4uDOaqe_w.text: Ordered the pad thai and it was more like bland Thai. We also ordered the Roti Chanai as a starter which was cold and very disappointing. Although this place is cheap, go elsewhere and pay 1-2 pounds more per dish.

tIghbAPBO5nF4syF3SomaA.text: Tuk Tuk is an excellent place to grab a quick lunch for under £6. The service is very quick, the food is very good for the money and the portions are large enough to satisfy a lunch-time binge.The menu is typical of a cheap noodle bar- they do a good selection of fried noodles, some excellent varieties of laksa (which are huge) and some good appertisers- the mixed fried starter is excellent and good to share between a group. Apart from the laksa, the food here is mainly unhealthy- mainly fried and quite greasy- but it is generally better than other cheap noodle places and because of its good, central location you can just about forgive it.

ftfDso0lZXEfEiAAMghYzA.text: Quick service, fast food and straight to the point. An average meal plus drink costs about £6-7 in total. I recommend the Nasi goreng sprinkled with hot chili sauce hmm. If you're looking for something quick, relatively cheap and tasty while you're in Soho, this is the place to go.

QbehuccwErrL1G85H3kYUQ.text: more onhungryinlondon.com/2010/…  It's cheap. That's about the only positive thing I can say about TukTuk Noodle Bar in Soho. As the name promises it serves all kinds of Asian noodle dishes. I am hardly ever in Central London during the week at lunch time and why oh why did I not just queue at Koya? Well, too late for regrets, just don't make the same mistake as me and do keep away from this restaurant. Around this time of the year with temperatures around freezing I need to eat noodle soup all the time to survive. (Even though I am Austrian and I should be used to the cold I think I am rather meant for tropical temperatures). So I opted for the TomYum Soup with chicken. I usually love the hot and sour flavours of Tom Yum soup, it really warms you from within. The Tuk Tuk version was not hot but too sour. I would have forgiven this for the price (3.90) but what I could not forgive was the fact that the chicken was so tough that I nearly lost a tooth (and mind you, I have remarkably good teeth). I have seriously never in my entire life come across chicken so absolutely inedible. The chicken disaster is not the only negative thing I have to point out. The restaurant smelled weird, of a mixture of toilet cleaner and something more unpleasant. The service was hostile. I only got a hint of a smile when I left Well, they won't see me return :)

xmUijHXcJesz8WE5TcwQ8Q.text: The food in here is greasy, oily, unhealthy, nothing is fresh, and the service is unpleasant. Pad Thai is a pretty basic Thai dish and hard to get wrong, which they sure did. They served it cold, it almost looked as if it had come off of someone else's plate, the noodles were all crispy and broken and looked like leftovers you give to the dog. And guess what, when I dug around this meal which wouldn't have been out of place in an "I'm a celebrity, get me out of here" bushtucka trail, I FOUND A BLACK HAIR stuck to the plate. Please do not go to this establishment. Do not be seduced by the prices. It really is Vile. The soft drinks are all flat and come out of a bottle. Awful.

nHcRArnpydb-UisnUREsZw.text: Tuk Tuk noodles is the ideal place for a quick bite at an affordable price. You don't have to wait more then a couple of minutes for food to arrive and it tastes pretty decent too. Formally Mr Woo, Tuk Tuk is similar in that it offers a buffet menu but the difference is the quality of the food. Where's with Mr Woo you would visit once and then stay clear for a couple of years, Tuk Tuk is a quality establishment.  If your not keen on the idea of buffet, then fear not, there is a normal menu to choose from. But don't be greedy like I once was and order 4 different dishes, as the portions are large and you will struggle getting through them all. Not a place to take someone for a romantic date but worth a visit if your hungry and want something quick and cheap. Buffet from 5 pound, other meals from 10 pound for main meal and starter.

N9sVKA5k0zhRZ0rrutPtoA.text: In this part of Soho, it's hard to find good cheap food that doesn't come with either a side order of grease or that has been sat in a window all day. Tuk Tuk is a very basic looking cafe, but yet it does in the job in producing hearty platefuls of food that help keep the hunger at the bay. The menu is a mixture of dishes from all over South-East Asia and having never tried Bornean food before I couldn't resist trying the Bornean chicken dish. A dish that was both simple and effective, prices are extremely low and the restaurant is licensed so you can enjoy a variety of bottled beers with your lunch.

zw_ccUhHcsKlsi-BSSdW5A.text: Lovely Thai Cuisine!  Decent prices, friendly service, good food!

APwXQo9_4Ah2TZIlA0JW5Q.text: Some times all you really want is a large plate of tasty, MSG laced food, a cold beer and not to be bankrupted and in this part of Soho it can be difficult to get a substantial meal for under a tenner. At Tuk Tuk you can be full with under £5 in here, whether it's a generous serving of phad thai or enough nasi goreng to feed an elephant. The service is swift and politely anti-social...I mean, they're not gonna keep checking up on you or topping up your drink. They just slam the plate down and you stuff your face. Easy! So all in all perfect if you're starving and don't fancy paying an arm and a leg for nouvelle cuisine.

Sdy5B9yavgQlleWwG6YvYw.text: Tuk Tuk Noodle Bar is one of the great quick-food staples of central london. If you want cheap, tasty food, and you want it fast- then look no further. The restaurant is nearly always busy, and sometimes a small queue forms in the door on friday/saturday evenings, but there is a fast turnover of tables so there is never usually a long wait. The food itself is great- a large bowl of soup/noodles sets you back only £3.90, and the portions are huge!situated on old compton street, it's ideal for a quick pre-theatre dinner or filling your stomach before heading to one of the many bars/clubs in the area.

qgt1wlhFmCLUKToX9XtA0A.text: It is a very good restaurant, it's because they have a worlderfull food, and the prices are very usefull for all kind of people.  I will recommend for sure!

Mtdev9yxEBZJ92kDvJvqQQ.text: Does pretty much what it sets out to do - high turnover of customers,big satisfying portions of food,non discript service and you're on your way.Which is sometimes all you want.

6i3kbRZQab3PCNHk9KaAyg.text: I like this place- great for a quick bite to eat. It is inexpensive with a great choice. The staff are polite and attentive. The starters were nice- a mixed platter containing fishcakes, ribs, sping rolls etc. I had chicken noodles for my main course, which were a little bland. My friend had curry though, which was delicious. A great stop off for lunch or a quick dinner.

mpzlp2WpDWds-O-Dg8krvA.text: I will keep this short as I just took away one dish which I was the green curry chicken with white rice.Simply put this is probably the worst incarnation of this dish I've ever had. Th rice to chicken ratio was way too high, and there was only a tiny amount of curry to boot. The chicken was of the breaded kind, which leads me to believe this chicken is used in their other dishes such as lemon chicken too. This was much like breaded chicken with some green curry gravy drizzled on top. DisappointedUpdate: forgot to mention that this thing had one thing going for it... Which is that it's relatively cheap

VETSyDeupsB8H4IktSYt1w.text: Disgusting. Chinese food dressed up as Thai food. The dishes were bland and the chicken in the 'green curry fried rice' was fried and hard as a rock. The owner came out and said 'oh it's ok it's just like that'. Avoid at all costs. The people running this place are not Thai, neither is the food.

ns-4mzaBA3o7ZcqcsmqBDg.text: This is a Positive review. Tuk Tuk is fine. It's Cheap.It's Quick.It's Clean. For a quick, cheap and cheerful bite in soho.

sl8G_6PlysGr71j0yaJqPQ.text: A cheap, fast place is you want decently-tasting noodles or rice dishes.  Chicken pad Thai was alright, but I wish it had been more flavorful (however, it's difficult to beat the £4.90 price).  Good for a quick lunch.

e_5ZmTSJWRh0N7ijes5wUQ.text: I had lunch here recently. I will definitely try other places nearby before I have a lunch here again. It wasn't bad, per se, but it certainly wasn't good enough to repeat.I ordered the Monk's Delight which theoretically includes vegetables and tofu and rice. The rice was there in good measure, but I think I counted 2, maybe 3 small cubes of tofu. The portion size was quite small and bland.The service was not particularly good, but they brought the mains quickly. Then the size of spring rolls I ordered came when I was halfway through with my main. The sauce that comes with the spring rolls was tasty.

ioyVr8G3-GUXYh-F-flTQg.text: I went for a late lunch here today with a couple of friends. The service was fast and friendly and the prices were extremely reasonable! the kind of place I like!I had the laksa soup, and it was REALLY good. One friend had pad thai and another had the crispy duck. £21 for three lunches and three drinks is definitely a steal in Soho.

m2lykd1hF0rr2_YHW266Yw.text: Are you hungry?Are you drunk?Are you lacking grease in your diet?Are you in soho?Do you have £4.50 in cash burning a hole in your pocket?Do you fancy some MSG?If any one of these gets a yes, consider this place, two, you might like it, three, prepare for the most satisfying meal of your life!

j52g26IfgjRf9YdgGh4wMQ.text: For 3 and a half weeks I ate nothing but Pork! My wife and I took a tour of Europe, and while all the sausage, ham, bratwurst ,pig knuckle,bacon was delicious, we were craving something not so heavy. We noticed Tuk Tuk just walking around SOHO and decided to try it. They are a Thai/Noodle restaurant that serves warm, quick food that was really tasty. I had the Pad Thai with Chicken and Prawns, it came with cooked veggies and noodles with just enough spice in it that it didn't overcome the flavor of the dish. It was a colder night out so I warmed up with a spicy noodle soup, and cooled off my tongue with a Lemonade ice tea. Quick and tasty food that wasn't too expensive either.

nDsZWUv64uzMIRM3v9Zwxg.text: Amazing restaurant !As has been said before, its got a great quality/price ratio.Service is very fast and effective.However, as in most chinese restaurants, they can rush you to order when you get there slightly late.Also, they once forgot to give us 10£ back from the bill we paid. For those 2 reasons, I don't give them a 5-star.The duck with shrimp sauce, as is the Musaman Lamb, the Pad Thai, and the Duck curry are real treats.Enjoy !

qlIwbx_mfNQcB5T8iSi91A.text: I don't eat here, only take-out.Call in and five minutes later your food will be ready for pick up - I like anywhere that I can order from as I walk out the door and expect the food to be ready once I arrive.I typically order green chicken curry, which is fine but nothing to rave about. Must order rice separately.Encouragingly, their food is served very, very hot, leading me to believe they make everything to order.Enjoy!

8srQ3LMO4Bj_K2TZ2m3-hQ.text: London is expensive. I am shopoholic coming to the end of my gap yaaaa and about to embark on the world of freelance. Money is scarce. At the end of a recent trip I was hungry and announced to the group....my dinner budget is £4. Seriously.Tuk Tuk was quickly decided as my nose wrinkled at the sound of road side chips. First impressions, I'll be honest, shoddy. I am a snob and had my pals not insisted I'd have spun around and headed to BK or summit.I slumped down, verging on sulking and opened the menu. Prices were ridic!! So cheap. And having decided on the same as Huddy, I had a noodle soup veggie soup thingy and a tap water. £3.90 later I am laughing with joy at how delishously full I am and that I spent less than I would in KFC. Food arrived super fast and was scrummy.Plus sat next to me was Lucy from x-factor 2009 AND Owen from Enders was behind me. Can't be the hole I thought it was!!

70GnXhWZ_lhWtsoK5roRnQ.text: Cheap.Bland, uninspired food made with poor ingredients. Probably benefits greatly from its location. Much better fare to be had nearby.

q1cLiJr5k3FINYNa-_dsZw.text: Good quality tasty chinese (and surrounding areas) food at bargain prices. You get a lot of food for your money here, and it's well worth a visit :)

SsfVLM_zgv6owLgge_T-iA.text: Terrible grainy curry with one piece of eggplant. I was shocked that it had such high marks on Yelp.

5FgjvFVr_REnse2nVzyAoA.text: Fast to seat us. Fast to take our orders. Fast to serve us our food. And even faster to give us our bill (hallelujah!!!). Cheap and yummy. By the time you finish reading this the TukTuk server would have had your order by now.Stars all around! Can't wait to return when I get my Chinese food craving.

pmFGEo_GDc7kYaLKhhcV8w.text: This'll teach me for being spontaneous.  Couldn't fault the service, or the very decent house white. But can very fault the below par pad Thai jay (sloppy), and the veggie rice dish (bland).  We were on our way to a better place. Wish we had gone now.

PGB3gUlj97g3avl2KoYZ5Q.text: So, it's not the most authentic Chinese food in all of London but gee whiz does it hit the spot!It's not going to win any awards for class of finesse, but a normal-sized, delicious chicken pad thai for £3.80? Uh, YES please! Located in the heart of soho, if you can make it here before they close, you will not be disappointed. The special fried rice is pretty darn memorable too.Usually the service is amazingly fast, but this last time it must have been amateur night in the kitchens because there was a period of close to 20 minutes when NO food was being brought out and people were getting annoyed. Otherwise, excellent place to eat on the cheap and people watch drunk crazies. :)

g5JitjsM-S5OXEIBtAVCfg.text: Sometimes when I get homesick for America I go to tuk tuk for chinese food... wait that doesn't make sense.the second I think about it my mouth starts craving it.This is a terrible reason to love a chinese restaurant in china town, but my friend and I have agreed it's Americanized. Sometimes you want something where you know what to expect. it's a comfort.But don't let this dissuade you, tuk tuk is still amazing. This same friend and I once RAN through old compton street b/c we wanted to make sure we made it to tuk tuk in time before it closed.It's cheap and it's fast and it's clean, and the pad thai is what I think of when i crave pad thai. Tuk tuk you addictive bastard.

klQOJuFut3xN5ot3H01OBA.text: No tut tut for Tuk Tuk.Less glamorous than nearby Wagamama and Busaba Eathai but cheaper for similar fare. They have a variety of mainly noodle dishes and starters from a variety of oriental countries. The food arrives fast and does taste as it should with the distinctive flavour notes of the particular country of origin.A fast option for oriental noodles in Soho.

Di0tc84GsQ0oW2TdHFM-lQ.text: Great place. Very tasty food, friendly and welcoming staff and warm atmosphere. As far as I know all their noodles taste delicious so you can make a mistake in experimenting. On the other side watch how much you are eating as the bill seems to grow rapidly fast.

TNw3zNnHs_vtnX7YAdtrog.text: Tuk Tuk is great. It's super cheap so stick to the simple stuff. Order the pad thai. Done.I've had it both whilst sober and drunk. Obviously, the drunk experience tasted waaaaaay better but you know what, sober was actually pretty good too! For £4.90 - it's a bargain. And tastes so good - and I think they actually use tamarind paste in their sauce!

_Z8EwHqYvmoe46pkot5R7A.text: This is a cheap and cheerful place that you can stop by..the bill does not included services charge. I love the location here..it is right in the middle of old Compton street. Always busy with the soho crowd. Glad that it is out the way of china town restaurant which became expensive. I love the LAKSA and CHAY KEOY TEOW here..may be you should try that too

photos.caption: Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom

nYOnx28li2vRI1coT2CyJQ.text: Could the service people smile less and treat you. Worse????Food is Ok for the price...

VkljFDcSbFMbWWYheT88EQ.text: Do not go here. It's not good and the drunk people inside don't know what they're spending their money on.It's cheap, cheerful and convenient if you're around the area and need a quick Asian bite. It doesn't know whether it's Thai or Chinese. What I do know is that it's awful!I had the spicy roast duck noodle soup and my friends got the same and a pad Thai. All were competing for the prize of worst Asian food in London.The only thing that was good here was the Asahi beer. It they messed that one up, I'd be really worried.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom. Spicy roast duck noodle soup: looks bad, tastes even worse

2hTSbz1plPuM8u372CIn_w.text: Valued meal . 5.60 pounds for that portion and the taste and texture is good .  Adding  50 p u get a take away box and eat the remaining later on .If u r feeling budget , go for this one ! Perfectly fine for a solo Foodie :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom. Malaysian kway diao

9ewt4WUVN4gHqNBZXkWWZA.text: This place is alright for a quick bite to eat. The food is average, the service slightly spotty, but the prices are cheap. It's also right across the street from Biju Bubble Tea, which is delicious.I had the Buddhist Delight, craving some broccoli. However, there was a minimal amount of vegetables and quite a lot of white rice. The vegetables were cooked properly and were very good, but there just were not enough of them. My dinner guest got the green curry, and it was just average. With the curry, you have to pay for the rice separately but our waiter did not mention this; luckily we saw it on the menu.All in all, it's fairly cheap and faster than the average restaurant, but I will most likely never come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom. Not enough veggies !!

An71-9I7qJJhb2XURgVB4w.text: Love #11 on the menu. It is called Laksa and I get one every time I am in London!!! Seems appropriate for all weather since I have had some in winter and summer now.

ehqh5RMo9l1uzwr-McGkyA.text: And you would think good noodles are only found in chinatown.... N O! Finally stepped foot in this place. Pretty good prices considering the area. Food came promptly. Prompt- as in within 5 minutes. Literally! Mountain size portions yet delicious, hopefully not with msg! The calamari was a let down, or let's just say sides are not recommended. would definitely come back again! 2 noodles and a side was just £8! Can't believe it right, neither could I.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom. kway teow

-iG-G578FTiOsFS275C7Pg.text: Fair price for good Asian food in central London. Soho, quick and good service. I read in some other reviews that the quality of the food wasn't good, but I found everything nice and fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom

7EUU570F1cgpczzqCRyfig.text: I went to Tuk Tuk for takeaway during the afternoon. The waiters were very nice and friendly. I'm allergic to peanuts so I opt'ed to the spicy chicken noodles instead of a pad thai, expecting it to be similar to pad kee mao. Also ordered a thai iced milk tea to go.My expectations were low since the meal was so cheap - £4.50 for the noodles and £2 for the thai iced tea. I don't think I've had worse Thai food my entire life. The noodles were oily and did not taste at all like Thai food. The milk tea was watered down and tasted like I boiled a tea bag and added milk and sugar to it. Bottom line - I'll never go back even if I only had £5 and was starving.

3lt0YghDmvw01s1HAxx1UQ.text: As a Bloombury campus student, Tuk Tuk meets all of my essential requirements for eating "off-campus": location, price, and taste. I really enjoyed coming here for dinner after lectures or before starting a long night of studying in the library. It's also right across the street from my current favourite bubble tea place so you can have a delicious meal and grab some tea for dessert. For the price you get a nice portion of food. I was actually surprised considering this is right in the heart of Soho but I'm not complaining. Great for an (international) student budget. The noodles here are the best. I've had both the Singaporean style fried vermicelli which is awesome if you like heat. My favourite is the Chicken green curry with egg fried rice; mild and creamy, highly recommend. The chicken was cooked really well and I liked the flavour of the green curry. The fried rice was also nice and moist, just rice and egg so it's very simple. Everything on the menu looks really good, I can't wait to come back and try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom

GNqap2pc_1X3W8L7w-zKcA.text: This is my go to place in Soho for a Thai fix pre or post drinks. A great selection on the menu and all very reasonably priced. The Thai calamari are a favourite but can be a bit hit and miss, sometimes over cooked. Would recommend the Chicken Pad Thai and Green Curry. The decor is more greasy spoon cafe but that doesn't detract from how good the food is.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom. Thai calamari...so good!!!

1bwoBcR_V9UU_-6Gwe6UqA.text: After a long day of walking round that London there's northing better than sitting in a place that your mate has suggested and trying it for the first time.The staff are pretty decent but not very talkative which was fine by me.However the food was excellentI had bbq beef in a noodle soup and prawn toast. The only thing is the bill hadn't got the items listed or priced clearly. We knew it was roughly correct but it isn't smart service to just write a total on the bill.However I'd go back and drag other people with me.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom. Prawn toast
Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom. Bbq pork noodles

d-jePhaDuZmDgStrhoLzFw.text: Enjoyable Thai food with great service and reasonable prices. Menu is simple and they have photos to help. :)We ordered a chicken pad thai to split ... which came out to 4.50 pounds - close to 8 total with tax. The meal fed both of us. We loved how tender the chicken was ... we always seem to lament the chicken we get back in the States. The veggies fresh and the tamarind sauce - just right. Noodles were prefect and not too sticky. We loved it!! Definitely a great fast, easy, and affordable choice in the SoHo district!

ln4k_LBdo18g6FH_akw-lQ.text: This place is listed as a Thai restaurant. But it's really not. They have a smattering of Thai, Malaysian, Vietnamese and even some Chinese food. The prices are low, 5 pounds or so. But the quality and quantity is also mediocre. I had some Pad Thai. It wasn't really enough so I had another order of soup noodles.  So my meal ended up being 12 or 13 lbs, vs. the 7 or 8 lbs that I thought I signed up for.  If you're really not that hungry and just want a light bite in the neighborhood, this place works. If you want a proper meal, probably not.  By the way the staff is all Chinese.

nA4mgpVMWIGfeGNpeFX7hA.text: Ordered the Tom yam kai, which is noodles in Tom yum soup.  Good portion size with decent amount of chicken, noodles, bean sprouts and mushrooms.  Soup had the distinctive taste of Tom yum; sour and slightly spicy. Unfortunately it was rather watered down so had lost its 'oomph'. Oh well, next time we'll try something else on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom. Tom yum kai

ldTxyYt0ARL8BQgXEFzW0A.text: Ok quality,cheap and massive portions. I shared a vegetable red thai curry, vegetarian dumplings and a portion of steamed rice with my boyfriend and we paid £12,10 in total.  However, if you find a worst service in London please keep in touch ;)

SjDj7yhFU09HQF3o4Y6U2w.text: For about £11 per person you could order the set meal for two: soup, an appetizer platter, steamed rice, green chicken curry, stir fried vegetables, and beef with garlic sauce = quite a bargain! Although it was a bargain and we had variety for our meal, the quality was lower than expected. The appetizer platter included stale/old sides, not fresh at all. The spare ribs were dry, the fish cakes were stale, but the eggrolls were decent. The soup was fulfilling = mushrooms, cilantro, spicy/sour broth. The green chicken curry was decent but the other two plates were way too salty. I had mixed feelings about our meal because we had a chance to try a little bit of everything but the quality was on a seesaw scale. Hate to burst your bubble but this is a Thai restaurant run by Chinese people.

Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tuk Tuk - London, United Kingdom

q83dgxNFsa5tUrH4wgV-xw.text: They get all five stars for quality of food, ambience, hospitality, price and authenticity and location. Ordered crispy duck. Chicken satay, classic chicken fried rice and mei goreng chicken. All excellent food loved it

68fsRUHjdVB98tyD_t3Cvg.text: I've been here a few times already.  It's mostly when I'm on my own and wanting a quick and cheap meal as I couldn't be bothered to cook something at home after a long day of hard work.  The food satisfies the purpose.  The place itself is nothing to write home about.  The selections are quite southeast asian varied.  From Nasi Goreng to Pad Thai.  Sweet sour chicken on steamed rice or even dumplings (which I thought had a bit of a thick wanton wrap).When I was here last, I tried the mixed seafood Udon stir fry.  The portion is not too extravagant (which is perfect for me).  For example, in comparison to the portions in Young Cheng (Shaftesbury Avenue), Tuk Tuk's servings are smaller.  There were enough seafood pieces (of prawns, squid, mussel meats and crab meats).  The simplicity of the taste is good enough for me.  What I appreciate about this place is the fact that you get what you expect.  Honest food I'd say.  Probably why I will keep coming back (and yes... mostly when I'm on my own).
